Text: "Tears of Diablos"!

From the intel that we gathered from Karen...I mean,
No. 111, that particular phrase stood out.

Those "Tears" appear to be an essential element that
defines the Rounds within the Cult.
"Tears"...huh?
What do you mean by "appear to be"?

No. 111 lacked any detailed knowledge about the
"Tears of Diablos." What we do know is that it's
considered significant to the Rounds.

And there seems to be a belief since long ago that
the "Tears" are closely linked to the symptoms of
the possessed.
Possession is a strange thing.

Even if you slash off and amputate the affected area,
the sarcoma instantly swells up, and the symptoms
reappear!
Ha, ha, ha... It truly is a curse!
You call it a curse? Do you know nothing?!
You say I know nothing?

Of course I do! I know about the "Tears" and how
they're created!
Wh-What?!

However! Knowing about it and sharing it with the
Round Table are two different matters!
Y-You bastard! So you've turned against the Cult—

Just before Eta and I intervened, I can confirm the
word "Tears" was mentioned during the argument
between Sergey and No. 111.

Their recognition of the possessed symptoms not being
due to a curse...is quite intriguing.

According to No. 111, it's strange for Sergey, who is
only a Child, to know how to create the "Tears of
Diablos."

However, Sergey's reply was something along the lines
that he doesn't rely on these "Tears."

Thus, we can not only speculate that the "Tears" is a
vital element for the Cult of Diablos,

but there's a high probability that Sergey is a Child
deeply connected to the Rounds.

Or, and this is a bit of a leap, Sergey himself may
not be a Child but one of the Rounds.

And if "Tears" are created...could they be some kind
of power source? Or a metaphor for abundant
resources?

The fact that they exist from a long time ago
is also intriguing.

None of the intel we've gathered until now about the
Cult mentioned anything about the Rounds or the
Children.

I guess that means this intel has only been disclosed
to the Rounds, and not to the Children.

Not only are the Rounds controlling the intel, but
they've kept any details about the "Tears" hidden
from those outside their ranks.

Irrespective of the reason behind their secrecy, it
seems the "Tears" hold a crucial role in the Cult of
Diablos' control over the world...

Do they serve as the governing force of the
organization itself, or are they perhaps a
pivotal element in shaping its foundation?

While we still do not know the true nature of the
"Tears" or Sergey's reasons for not pursuing them
within the organization,

we have made substantial progress in uncovering intel
on the Cult!

By investigating the Rounds, the Children...and
the "Tears," we should be able to gain a clearer
understanding of their true identities!

The Cult's practice of capturing the possessed to
experiment on them could also be connected to
the "Tears"...

It's worth delving deeper into their motives and
secrets. I'll reach out to Zeta and ask her to
proceed with this strategy.

Sergey Gorman, one of Velgalta's Seven Blades,
also known as a Child of the Cult...

To better understand the Cult and grasp the Rounds'
activities, we must uncover his true identity.

While I've read your and Eta's reports, it wouldn't
hurt to hear your firsthand experiences as well.
Of course! I'll go fetch Eta. Please wait!

Oh, I'll go with you, just in case. Take some time to
rest, Lady Alpha!
Just in case?
Ahaha... Just in case.

I'll prepare some tea. Lady Alpha, please take it
easy.

Th-Thank you... I suddenly find myself with nothing
to do.

You've been making plenty of tough decisions lately.
You owe it to yourself to rest.
R-Right... Well then, just until Eta gets here...

...There's no need for all of you to worry about me
so much... Heheh.
